name: stevegt500
text: what makes this is beef's ringtone

name: zem
text: what is that from ?

name: wehavemagnums
text: It's 'Institutionalized' by Suicidal Tendencies.

name: chaesar
text: That song is so goddamn hard to play on Guitar Hero...the tempo change...so hard.

name: firesign
text:
I think that's mainly so hard because Guitar Hero is about time-matching what the guitarist did originally, and ST's original guitarist was either so trashed or so inept while recording (and the pacing therefore wandered so much) that I doubt even he could ever recreate the exact pacing of the studio track.

Please note that this observation in no way diminishes my absolute love for that song and album ("I saw your mommy...": classic!). Skate punk was FAR removed from any concerns about whether your guitarist was Yngwie fucking Malmsteen or something, and that was definitely a good thing...

name: soilentshuggah
text: Cross-over thrash for the win.

name: nikopol
text: ALL I WANTED WAS A PEPSI, AND SHE WOULDN'T GIVE ME ONE

name: stuart
text:
I just downloaded this song, and started looking for this strip. Just as I found it this part of the song came up.

(I'd say it's a lot like Weird Al's Albuquerque except told by your manic depressive pothead buddy)

name: thorfinn
text: and about 20 years earlier

name: ghede
text: and a third the length.

name: stevegt500
text: and good

name: achilleselbow
text: This song pretty much defined our generation.

name: charchar
text: soundtrack for the strip.

name: tekende
text: Wow. Talk about a song that should never be made into a music video. That was laughable.

name: rad_chillies
text: word it balances out the Beatles.

name: cailetshadow
text: Beef's crotch is hella outraged about global apartheid.

name: leon_sumbitches
text: emeril is a wise man.

name: ttagxamm
text: This one strip adds great depth to his character.   He draws on keen insight and his network of trashspotters & collectors in tracking Philippe, and yet he's hook-in-mouth credulous about one of the plumb looniest of conspiracy theories.  It's like he has no filter for his ability to link facts and events and draw connections.

name: ttagxamm
text: Er, as has been pointed out previously, below.  Must read through the thread before acting like I'm soo smart.

name: blarghamagarky
text: That is why the tears they do come but they are not that often.

name: unsentletter
text:
> emeril is a wise man

Yes.

I want to know how he knows Zell and Cory...

name: gournal
text: Trashspotters and "collectors" will occassionally cross paths.

name: greenkoolayd
text: like a really cool adrien(sp?) monk....

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by kenthegod, craigola, tttt2)

name: geesycreesy
text: A comment left by geesycreesy was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, mygoodfriend, ih8jonmayr, gbeaton, Dwilow, Shinkicka)

name: cdl146
text: But if you've noticed, songs from Sgt. Peppers make up a large part of the "soundtrack" to many strips.

name: isunklower
text: Onstad has helped revitalize the Beatles for me by using their songs so weirdly out of context. Now, whenever something completely horrible and panicky is happening, I start wailing "Lovely Rita;" whenever I have to take a disgusting dead rat out of a trap, I hum "When I'm Sixty-Four." A new lease on life!

name: judahnielsen
text: I'm very fond of Emeril. this strip is one good reason why. Another is at the end of GOF, when he asks how the tenmen were.

name: snowman
text: This strip is what made me love Emeril.  The last panel, espesh.

name: patkun
text: I've only just noticed what an obvious mother figure for Philippe Téodor is...I guess Mr Bear is kind of like his stern father, and Ray and Roast Beef are his two crazy old uncles...

name: tombsgrave
text: I must say the moon landings weren't faked.  But the car blaring "Lovely Rita, Meter Maid" is awesome.  Is the tape stuck in the car?

name: tombsgrave
text: Not that I'm saying that Onstad believes the moon landin's were faked, of course, or that he has built a rocket to the moon to get some alone-time.

name: junko
text: This is rare for beign a long strip that has gold in pretty much every panel

name: straw
text: Is Sgt. Pepper's stuck in Beef's player?  Every time he's in it there's some song playing from that album.

name: chrissketch
text: I'm sorry, I can't think of a single reason one would need to desire to unstuck it.

name: firesign
text: ...Maybe you found your copy of Rubber Soul, instead?

name: hawaiian_robot
text:
Or Revolver, even?

(It's the best one)

name: i_love_kate
text: Guy Ritchie film? Heh, if you insist.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: Oh you

name: aaron_haynes
text: Everyone has a friend like Emeril. Unbelievably intelligent and practical, friendly, understanding, and also believes something completely fucking crazy.

name: chrissketch
text: Snopes and Skeptic.com helped me prevent myself from becoming THAT friend.

name: professorhazard
text: I'm still that friend. But that's okay, because Lyle and Emeril are good company to be in.

name: hassanoleary
text:
I was thinking the same thing. The mixture of brilliance and craziness is in those folks is itself frustrating, because one never knows whether the next topic of conversation will be intriguing or batshit insane.

"I was looking up meditation on the internet last night!" :)
"Let's talk about string theory!" :)
"9/11 was an inside job." :(

name: fermatprime
text: That would imply that string theory isn't completely fucking crazy or batshit insane.

name: saru
text:
xkcd is, in my opinion, probably the second most intelligent comic out there. Of course, rankings can be silly. xkcd could be most physics and engineering type intelligent, Achewood would be most intelligent culturally.
Monroe talks about this here .
Sometimes, being really intelligent just means you're really good at contorting logic to the view that you want to believe.

name: presterjohn
text: Achewood for culture, xkcd for science, cat and girl for humanities ... if these three comics crossed over the sheer coolness just might destroy the internet as we know it.

name: saru
text: Is it wrong to want to see this, even if it would mean the end of the Internet as we know it?

name: soticoto
text:
Girly wins for pure chaos.

And to be fair, Bunny : The Book of Random... wins for really obscure references.

name: professorhazard
text: roffle ecks dee

name: slalvation
text: That's my step-dad, except for the friendly and understanding part.

name: carrot
text: I love how Emeril believes the moon landings were faked even though Beef has been to the moon. So its not like it's impossible, just that certain moon landings were faked.

name: professorhazard
text:
Just the first one. It was important to fake getting there first, in order to stick it to the Russians.

Because an ancient Sumerian tablet states that whoever touches the moon first, wins.

name: ch
text: He probably doesn't have anymore eight track tapes. I had four eight-tracks in my old AMC Concorde, and that was it for audio entertainment ... the radio didn't work.

name: riazm
text:
Whenever someone gets a phonecall and I tell them to "Tell that guy he sucks!" They just say "Oh, and Riaz says you suck."

It gets awkward.

name: lucid
text: It's not your fault. They're not even trying to work that in.

name: i_love_kate
text: It's only on this read through that I begin to distinguish between TV chef Emeril and garbagespotter Emeril.

name: pez
text: hearing the intro to lovely rita while driving can be a very magical thing, but given the situation, its a bit too magical

name: foxtrotamend
text: hey, second Sgt. Pepper's reference in Achewood history.  Makes me smile.

name: thorfinn
text: If there were a rating higher than 5, this strip would get it, if only for squeezing Suicidal Tendencies and Beatles references into the same strip

name: ham_shoes
text: How appropriate that RB would have Suicidal Tendencies ringtone

name: tragicone
text: Emeril is a bit of the genius.

name: deovalente
text:
"All that I know is I see two missing things and not one."

This line made me fall in love with the character known as Emeril.

name: farqussus
text: I still assume they are talking about the generously eyebrowed chef. Until the mullet shows up.

name: rockstarsatemy
text:
I feel a little guilty, because the strip is so dark, but I just spit all over my screen.

The choice combination of a Galaxie and "Lovely Rita" =explosion of saliva.
When I was Phillipe's age, my mom drove a Galaxie. I threw up in it many times.

name: boredom_man
text: You likely drank too much Pepsi.

name: yearsinhotclaws
text:
I just noticed that emeril's speech is punctuated like Beef's.

Sorry if this is obvious to anyone.

name: puguglypress
text: Good eye!

name: jianna
text: all I wanted was a Pepsi, just one Pepsi, and she wouldn't give it to me.  JUST ONE PEPSI.

name: comrade_tom
text: Paul is dead.

name: erinye
text: Interesting. I'll bet Emeril has a few choice words on that as well.

name: stagnantdisplay
text: I bet Lyle is pissed that Roast Beef didn't tell Teodor that he sucks.

name: lolsworth
text: Panel 8 is the best thing ever to read aloud not written by Shakespeare.

name: stuntman
text: A dude given to conspiacies is likely to pick up on these things.

name: duperando
text: Best driving song ever. For reals.
